name: Fishbone Cactus
climate: Fishbone Cactus thrives in warm climates and prefers temperatures above 60Â°F.
It can adapt to higher humidity levels due to its tropical rainforest origins.
It does not tolerate frost; ensure that it is kept in warmer conditions.
In temperate climates, it is best grown indoors or in a controlled greenhouse.
sunlight: This plant prefers bright, indirect sunlight and thrives in such conditions.
Direct sunlight can be too harsh and may cause damage to the plant's leaves.
It can adapt to medium light levels, but growth might be slower.
Avoid placing it in dark corners; it needs some light exposure daily.
watering: The Fishbone Cactus prefers to be kept relatively moist but not waterlogged.
Water thoroughly, then allow the topsoil to dry out before watering again.
In winter, reduce watering as the plant enters a dormant phase.
Consistent overwatering can lead to root rot, a common issue in cacti.
soil: A well-draining cactus or succulent potting mix is ideal for this plant.
The soil should contain materials like perlite or pumice for better drainage.
A slightly acidic to neutral pH is suitable for the Fishbone Cactus.
Ensure your pot has drainage holes to prevent water stagnation in the soil.
extra_care_tip: Prune occasionally to maintain shape and remove any damaged leaves.
If grown indoors, rotating the plant can promote even growth.
Repot every couple of years to refresh soil and provide more growing space.
Fertilize monthly during the growing season with a balanced cactus fertilizer.
